He played three years at [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], where he won [[Treble (association football)|the domestic treble]] in the [[2013–14 S.L. Benfica season|2013–14 season]]. In July 2014 he joined [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] and, two years later, signed with [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] also in the Spanish [[La Liga]]. Gomes earned 37 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] for Portugal all youth levels accounted for, including six for [[Portugal national under-21 football team|the under-21s]]. He represented the nation at [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]] – winning the tournament – and the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup|2017 Confederations Cup]]. ==Club career== ===Benfica=== Born in [[Grijó (Vila Nova de Gaia)|Grijó]], [[Vila Nova de Gaia]], [[Porto District]], Gomes joined [[S.L. Benfica]]'s youth system at the age of 18, playing his last year as a junior with the [[Lisbon]] club. On 28 July 2012 he appeared in his first game with the first team, in a [[Exhibition game|friendly]] with [[Gil Vicente F.C.|Gil Vicente]],{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/emdirecto/1a-liga/interior/em-diretonova-chapa-cinco-2692004.html|title=Nova chapa cinco|trans-title=Another fiver|newspaper=[[O Jogo]]|language=pt|date=28 July 2012|accessdate=4 August 2012}} and spent [[2012–13 Segunda Liga|his first season]] as a senior with [[S.L. Benfica B|the reserve side]], competing in the [[Segunda Liga|second division]]. Gomes scored his first goals with Benfica B in league matches against [[S.C. Braga B|Braga B]] (2–2 home draw){{cite news|url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/2--liga/detalhe/benfica-b-sp-braga-b-2-2-andre-gomes-da-empate-nos-descontos-772861.html|title=Benfica B-Sp. Braga B, 2–2: André Gomes dá empate nos descontos|trans-title=Benfica B-Sp. Braga B, 2–2: André Gomes for the draw in injury time|newspaper=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]]|language=pt|date=11 August 2012|accessdate=14 February 2014}} and [[C.F. Os Belenenses|Belenenses]] (6–0, also at home).{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/2--liga/detalhe/benfica-b-belenenses-goleada-na-luz-6-0-775375.html|title=Benfica B-Belenenses: Goleada na Luz (6–0)|trans-title=Benfica B-Belenenses: Routing at the Luz (6–0)|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=27 August 2012|accessdate=19 January 2016}} On 18 October 2012, he made his official debut with the main squad, playing 25 minutes after coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Eduardo Salvio]] and netting in a [[2012–13 Taça de Portugal|4–0 win]] at [[S.C. Freamunde|Freamunde]], for the [[Taça de Portugal]].{{cite web|url=http://portugoal.net/index.php/more-benfica-news/37338-taca-benfica-cruise-past-freamunde |title=Taça: Benfica cruise past Freamunde|publisher=PortuGOAL|date=18 October 2012|accessdate=19 October 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222015706/http://portugoal.net/index.php/more-benfica-news/37338-taca-benfica-cruise-past-freamunde|archivedate=22 February 2014|df=}} Gomes' momentum in Benfica's first team continued on 27 October 2012, as he started and scored in a 3–0 away win over Gil Vicente in his first [[Primeira Liga]] appearance.{{cite web|url=http://www.portugoal.net/index.php/more-benfica-news/37563-new-look-benfica-return-to-table-top|title=New-look Benfica return to table top|publisher=PortuGOAL|date=28 October 2012|accessdate=28 October 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222013703/http://www.portugoal.net/index.php/more-benfica-news/37563-new-look-benfica-return-to-table-top|archivedate=22 February 2014|df=}} He continued, however, to be mainly associated with the B-team. On 31 January 2014, Benfica (and [[Benfica Stars Fund]]) sold 100% of Gomes' economic rights to a private company, Meriton Capital Limited, for €15 million, plus 25% of a future transfer fee.{{cite web|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi2004/emitentes/docs/fsd29830.pdf|title=Comunicado|trans-title=Announcement|publisher=[[Portuguese Securities Market Commission]]|language=pt|date=3 April 2014|accessdate=5 September 2014}} He remained at the [[Estádio da Luz]] until the end of [[2013–14 S.L. Benfica season|the campaign]].{{cite web|url=http://www.soccernews.com/benfica-cash-rodrigo-andre-gomes/137317/|title=Benfica cash in on Rodrigo, Andre Gomes|publisher=Soccer News|last=Lazarevic|first=Nemanja|date=1 February 2014|accessdate=9 February 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/peter-lim-benfica-andre-gomes-rodrigo/52ec4a94e4b0cbb7a075f5d0.html|title=Peter Lim, o homem que comprou os passes de Rodrigo e André Gomes|trans-title=Peter Lim, the men who bought the rights for Rodrigo and André Gomes|publisher=Mais Futebol|language=pt|date=1 February 2014|accessdate=19 August 2014}} On 16 April 2014, Gomes played the full 90 minutes in the second leg of the semi-finals of the [[2013–14 Taça de Portugal|Portuguese Cup]], scoring the final 3–1 after a brilliant individual effort to help his team – who played with one man less for 60 minutes against [[FC Porto|Porto]] – win the tie 3–2 on aggregate.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2606506/Benfica-3-1-Porto-agg-3-2-Match-report-Andre-Gomes-books-Eagles-Portuguese-Cup-final-place-Jorge-Jesus-Ricardo-Quaresma-red-fans-invade-pitch-stormy-clash.html|title=Benfica 3–1 Porto (agg 3–2): Andre Gomes books Eagles' Portuguese Cup final place as Jorge Jesus and Ricardo Quaresma see red and fans invade pitch in stormy clash|newspaper=[[Daily Mail]]|last=Homewood|first=Brian|date=16 April 2014|access-date=4 June 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2014/04/17/futbol/futbol_internacional/1397687122.html|title=El Benfica remonta y pasa a la final de Copa|trans-title=Benfica come back from behind and reach Cup final|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=17 April 2014|accessdate=17 April 2014}} He ended [[2013–14 Primeira Liga|the season]] with 23 games all competitions comprised, helping the club win the first [[Treble (association football)|treble]] in its history (league, cup and [[2013–14 Taça da Liga|Taça da Liga]]). ===Valencia=== On 17 July 2014, Gomes agreed to a one-season loan deal with [[Valencia CF|Valencia]],{{cite web|url=http://www.valenciacf.com/ver/36381/comunicado-oficial-del-valencia-cf.html|title=Comunicado oficial|trans-title=Official announcement|publisher=Valencia CF|language=es|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Internacional/espanha/interior.aspx?content_id=895137|title=Valencia regista André Gomes como emprestado pelo Benfica|trans-title=Valencia register André Gomes as loaned by Benfica|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140720002942/http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Internacional/espanha/interior.aspx?content_id=895137|archivedate=20 July 2014|df=dmy-all}} joining a host of compatriots including manager [[Nuno Espírito Santo]]. Although his economic rights were owned by [[Peter Lim]], a loan deal was arranged to take him and [[Rodrigo (footballer, born 1991)|Rodrigo]] to the Spanish club due to Lim's purchase of the latter.{{cite web|url=https://rr.sapo.pt/bolabranca_detalhe.aspx?fid=47&did=155784|title=Valência procura "forma jurídica" para levar Rodrigo e André Gomes|trans-title=Valencia look for "legal way" to take Rodrigo and André Gomes|publisher=[[Rádio Renascença]]|language=pt|date=15 July 2014|accessdate=19 August 2014}} Gomes made his [[La Liga]] debut on 23 August 2014, starting in a 1–1 away draw against [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]].{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_1/sev_val/|title=Punto de fe del Valencia|trans-title=Valencia point of faith|newspaper=Marca|last=Campos|first=Tomás|location=Madrid|language=es|date=23 August 2014|accessdate=3 September 2014}} He scored his first goal in the competition on 22 September, netting the second of a 3–0 away win over [[Getafe CF|Getafe]].{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_4/get_val/|title=El naranja pinta muy bien|trans-title=Orange is such a great colour|newspaper=Marca|last=Melero|first=Delfín|location=Madrid|language=es|date=22 September 2014|accessdate=19 January 2016}} On 12 June 2015, Benfica and Valencia announced they had reached an agreement on Gomes' federative rights. Subsequently, he signed a contract with the Spaniards until 30 June 2020.{{cite web|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi/emitentes/docs/FR56142.pdf|title=Comunicado|trans-title=Announcement|publisher=Portuguese Securities Market Commission|language=pt|date=12 June 2015|access-date=12 June 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://en.valenciacf.com/ver/41501/comunicado-oficial---andre-gomes.html|title=André Gomes joins Valencia CF on a permanent deal through to 2020|publisher=Valencia CF|date=12 June 2015|access-date=12 June 2015}} ===Barcelona=== On 21 July 2016, [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] announced they had reached an agreement with Valencia for the transfer of Gomes,{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36862314|title=Andre Gomes: Barcelona agree deal to sign Valencia midfielder|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=21 July 2016|access-date=21 July 2016}} for a fee of €35 million, plus €20 million in add-ons.{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/barcelona-sign-andre-gomes-valencia-8473083|title=Barcelona to sign Andre Gomes from Valencia after 'agreeing €55million deal' for Portugal midfielder|newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]]|last=Corless|first=Liam|date=21 July 2016|access-date=24 July 2016}} He made his competitive debut on 17 August, playing the full 90 minutes in a [[2016 Supercopa de España|3–0 home win]] against Sevilla for the [[Supercopa de España]] and being directly involved in two of the goals.{{cite news|url=http://www.sport-english.com/en/news/barca/barcelona-3-0-sevilla-5-0-agg-arda-turan-and-leo-messi-seal-super-cup-win-5330613|title=Barcelona 3–0 Sevilla (5–0 agg): Arda Turan and Leo Messi seal Super Cup win|newspaper=[[Sport (Spanish newspaper)|Sport]]|last=Sharma|first=Rik|date=18 August 2016|access-date=18 August 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://www.sport.es/es/noticias/barca/andre-gomes-marcaje-5330468|title=André Gomes se 'disfrazó' de Iniesta participando en dos goles|trans-title=André Gomes 'disguised' as Iniesta by taking part in two goals|newspaper=Sport|last=López|first=Ricard|language=es|date=18 August 2016|access-date=18 August 2016}} Gomes scored his first goal for the team on 19 March 2017, closing a 4–2 home win against his former club Valencia.{{cite news|url=http://www.sport-english.com/en/news/barca/andre-gomes-scores-his-first-goal-for-barcelona-against-his-former-club-5910749|title=Andre Gomes scores his first goal for Barcelona... against his former club|newspaper=Sport|date=19 March 2017|access-date=22 March 2017}} He was voted the worst signing of [[2016–17 La Liga|the season]] by readers of ''[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/primera-division/2017/05/24/59257eeae2704e78028b45da.html|title=Messi se cuela en LaLiga más blanca|trans-title=Messi sneaks into the whitest LaLiga|newspaper=Marca|last=Roca|first=Álvaro|location=Madrid|language=es|date=25 May 2017|access-date=25 May 2017}} In [[2017 Copa del Rey Final|the final]] of the [[Copa del Rey]], however, he replaced injured [[Javier Mascherano]] early into the first half of the match against [[Deportivo Alavés|Alavés]], playing mostly as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] and providing the [[Assist (football)|assist]] for [[Neymar]] who netted the second in an eventual [[2016–17 Copa del Rey|3–1 triumph]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39909498|title=Barcelona 3–1 Alavés|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 May 2017|accessdate=28 May 2017}} On 9 August 2018, and even though he was nursing a leg injury sustained during pre-season,{{cite web|url=https://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/futebol-internacional/futebol-espanhol/noticia/andre-gomes-desfalcara-o-barcelona-por-dois-meses-diz-radio.ghtml|title=André Gomes desfalcará o Barcelona por dois meses, diz rádio|trans-title=Barcelona to make do without André Gomes for two months, says radio|publisher=[[Rede Globo|Globo Esporte]]|language=pt|date=29 July 2018|accessdate=14 August 2018}} Gomes moved to English club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on a [[2018–19 Premier League|season]]-long loan for a fee of €2.25 million.{{Cite web|url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/news/2018-2019/agreement-with-everton-for-the-loan-of-andre-gomes-fcbarcelona|title=Agreement with Everton for the loan of André Gomes|publisher=FC Barcelona|date=9 August 2018|accessdate=9 August 2018}} He made his [[Premier League]] debut on 21 October, playing 82 minutes in a 2–0 home win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45853586|title=Everton 2–0 Crystal Palace|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Jurejko|first=Jonathan|date=21 October 2018|accessdate=7 November 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/andre-gomes-everton-debut-impressive-15315463|title=Why Andre Gomes' Everton debut was so impressive as Marco Silva's attacking gamble pays off|newspaper=[[Liverpool Echo]]|last=Jones|first=Adam|date=21 October 2018|accessdate=25 November 2018}} ==International career== [[File:Russia-Portugal CC2017 (5).jpg|thumb|Gomes playing against [[Russia national football team|Russia]] at the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]]]] Gomes represented [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal]] at the [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/seleccao/edgar-borges-convocatoria-portugal-europeu-sub-19/1354495-1194.html|title=Euro de sub-19: Sporting e Benfica em maioria nos convocados|trans-title=Under-19 Euro: Sporting and Benfica dominate squad|publisher=Mais Futebol|language=pt|date=11 June 2012|accessdate=4 August 2012}} At the age of 19 he received his first call-up to [[Portugal national football team|the senior team]], for a friendly against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] on 6 February 2013,{{cite news|url=http://www.abola.pt/nnh/ver.aspx?id=380552|title="Jesus tem-me ensinado muita coisa" – André Gomes|trans-title="Jesus has taught me many things" – André Gomes|newspaper=[[A Bola]]|language=pt|date=4 February 2013|accessdate=4 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130208011834/http://www.abola.pt/nnh/ver.aspx?id=380552|archive-date=8 February 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} but remained unused in the 2–3 home loss.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/friendlies/season=2014/matches/round=2000374/match=2011317/postmatch/report/|title=Portugal succumb at home to Ecuador|publisher=UEFA|date=6 February 2013|accessdate=8 October 2015}} Gomes made his full debut on 7 September 2014, starting and playing the full 90 minutes in a 0–1 loss to [[Albania national football team|Albania]] at the [[Estádio Municipal de Aveiro]] for the [[UEFA Euro 2016]] [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualification|qualifiers]].{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/portugal-vs-albania/1653150/report|title=Portugal 0–1 Albania: Seleccao stunned by Balaj beauty|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|last=Balaj|first=Bekim|date=7 September 2014|accessdate=7 September 2014}} He was selected for the squad that appeared in the finals in France,{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/portugal/story/2874983/new-bayern-munich-signing-renato-sanches-picked-for-portugal-squad|title=Portugal name Bayern Munich signing Renato Sanches for Euros squad|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|date=17 May 2016|accessdate=14 June 2016}} starting in their first game, a 1–1 draw to [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] in [[Saint-Étienne]] where he provided the [[Assist (football)|assist]] to [[Nani]]'s goal before being replaced by [[Eder (Portuguese footballer)|Eder]] late into the second half.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000448/match=2017959/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Ice-cool Iceland claim Portugal point|publisher=UEFA|last=Burke|first=Chris|date=14 June 2016|accessdate=14 June 2016}} Gomes also represented Portugal at the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]] in [[Russia]],{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/internacional/selecao/noticias/interior/direto--os-convocados-de-portugal-para-a-taca-das-confederacoes-8506152.html|title=Éder fica fora dos convocados, Beto e José Sá nas escolhas|trans-title=Éder out of squad, Beto and José Sá picked|newspaper=O Jogo|language=pt|date=25 May 2017|accessdate=18 September 2017}} playing four times as they finished in third place.{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/matches/round=274643/match=300334886/match-report.html#nosticky|title=Portugal come from behind to finish third|publisher=FIFA|date=2 July 2017|accessdate=15 September 2017}} He was included in a preliminary 35-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]],{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad – 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced?|publisher=Goal|date=17 May 2018|accessdate=17 May 2018}} but did not make the final cut.{{cite web|url=https://www.sbs.com.au/news/portugal-world-cup-squad|title=Nearly half Portugal's Euro squad to miss World Cup|publisher=[[Special Broadcasting Service]]|date=17 May 2018|accessdate=17 May
